intro: Cryptolappa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cryptolappa, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
